page.title: 12ROOKERY FARM, ALPRAHAM.
page.content: Rookery Farm is the home of{Mrs. B. {Cooke. }Her son-in-law,{Mr.D. Symms, helps her to run the farm. It has 200 acres which is divded into l3 fields. This is a{Dairy Farm}and has 125 cows in milk and 75 calves. Mr. Symms pays a visit to{Beeston Cattle Market}once a fortnight to buy and sell cattle. The{Milk Quota}for this farm is 678,000 litres per year. Rookery Farm is used for the local Spring{Point-to-Point Meeting}of the Cheshire Hunt. During this time all the cattle have to be kept inside. Mr. Symms thinks the farm was named 'Rookery' because there was a Rookery in the woods nearby.
